In case you haven't noticed, I've been waiting for two hours.
ko: 너 모르는 것 같은데, 나 두 시간째 기다리고 있어.

en: Listen to this!
Don't believe everything you hear.
From what I've heard, their marriage is on the rocks.
ko: 내가 듣기로는 걔네 결혼 생활 위태위태하대.

en: According to what I heard, he went over to America to study biology.
ko: 듣기로는 걔 생물학 공부하러 미국 갔대.

en: Nobody had ever heard of it.
Scratch a Russian and find a Tartar.
ko: 러시아 사람을 조금만 파헤쳐 보면 본색이 나와.

en: Civilization is now threatened by nuclear war.
ko: 이제 핵전쟁 때문에 인류 문명이 위협받고 있어.

en: The progress of civilization is very rapid.
The more civilization advances, the more people long for nature.
ko: 문명이 발전할수록 사람들은 자연을 더 그리워해요.

en: As civilization advances, poetry almost necessarily declines.
ko: 문명이 발전하면서 시는 거의 필연적으로 쇠퇴하게 돼요.

en: I don't have any money.
You should try to produce grammatical sentences.
ko: 문법에 맞는 문장을 쓰려고 노력해야 해요.

en: Grammar, which I hate, is good for me.
ko: 제가 싫어하는 문법이 저한테는 도움이 돼요.

en: Although I really hate grammar, it's useful.
I got the grammar lesson without difficulty.
ko: 문법 수업은 별 어려움 없이 잘 이해했어요.

en: There are grammatical principles involved.
The basic principles of grammar are not so difficult.
ko: 문법의 기초 원리는 그렇게 어렵지 않아요.

en: Your composition is correct, as far as grammar is concerned.
ko: 문법적으로만 보면 이 작문은 틀린 게 없어요.

en: Grammar be hanged.
Everyone likes Fumio because he is honest.
Style is to the writer what color is to the painter.
ko: 화가에게 색채가 중요하듯 작가에게는 문체가 중요해요.

en: You must begin a sentence with a capital letter.
Literature flourishes best when it is half a trade and half an art.
ko: 문학은 절반은 직업이고 절반은 예술일 때 가장 번창해요.

en: Written words, carrier pigeons, the telegraph, and many other devices carried ideas faster and faster from man to man.
ko: 글자, 전서구, 전신 같은 여러 수단들이 사람 사이에 생각을 점점 더 빠르게 전달해 줬어요.

en: Complaining won't change anything.
ko: 불평해 봤자 바뀌는 건 아무것도 없어요.

en: Stop complaining and do as you're told.
ko: 그만 좀 투덜대고 시키는 대로 하세요.

en: Don't complain. You have to go.
Don't complain.
Don't complain about that. You've asked for it.
ko: 그거에 대해 불평하지 마세요. 자초한 일이니까요.

en: Will you please use indelible ink so the phrase won't rub out?
ko: 글자가 안 지워지게 지워지지 않는 잉크 좀 써 주실래요?

en: If you have a complaint let me hear it. There's a difference between superficial obedience and honest loyalty you know.
ko: 불만이 있으면 말해 봐요. 겉으로만 복종하는 거랑 진심으로 충성하는 건 다르잖아요.

en: Reading literary criticism is very helpful to understanding literature.
ko: 비평을 읽는 게 문학을 이해하는 데 큰 도움이 돼요.

en: From a literary point of view, his work is a failure.
ko: 문학적인 관점에서 보면 그 사람 작품은 실패작이에요.

en: Reading of literature nourishes the mind.
ko: 문학을 읽는 건 마음의 양식이 돼요.

en: Literature teaches us about humanity.
ko: 문학은 우리에게 인간성에 대해 가르쳐 줘요.

en: Literature reflects human activity as carried on by the best minds.
ko: 문학은 뛰어난 지성들이 이뤄낸 인간 활동을 반영해요.

en: I will lecture on literature.
The trade of critic, in literature, music, and the drama, is the most degraded of all.
ko: 문학, 음악, 연극 비평가라는 직업은 세상에서 가장 천한 직업이에요.

en: Our school festival was held last month.
A cultural heritage is handed down to posterity.
We have to consider the problem in the light of cultural differences.
ko: 문화적 차이라는 관점에서 그 문제를 생각해 봐야 해요.

en: Culture is handed down from generation to generation.
Countries differ in culture.
Culture destroys language.
Culture destroys languages.
Sentences begin with a capital letter.
The style is the man himself.
Get the meaning of a word from its context.
A capital letter is used at the beginning of a sentence.
The first word of every sentence should be capitalized.
ko: 모든 문장의 첫 글자는 대문자로 써야 해요.

en: A sentence normally has a subject and a verb.
The atmosphere can become rather strained.
The atmosphere was uncomfortable.
There can be no human society without conflict.
ko: 갈등 없는 인간 사회는 있을 수 없어요.

en: The bronze statue was broken into pieces.
Mix the flour with two eggs.
ko: 밀가루에 계란 두 개를 넣고 섞으세요.

en: A man of prudence wouldn't say such things.
ko: 신중한 사람이라면 그런 말을 하지는 않겠죠.

en: A sensible man wouldn't say such a thing in public.
ko: 분별 있는 사람이라면 사람들 앞에서 그런 말을 안 할 거예요.

en: A man of sense would be ashamed to do so.
ko: 상식이 있는 사람이라면 그런 짓을 부끄러워할 거야.

en: A sensible person is one who uses good sense.
ko: 분별 있는 사람은 상식적으로 행동하는 사람이야.

en: Try to live within your income.
You should try to live within your income.
ko: 수입 범위 안에서 살도록 노력해야 해.

en: Cut your coat according to your cloth.
In my analysis I rely considerably on the types of authoritarian behaviour first analyzed by Kurz.
ko: 내 분석은 커즈가 처음 분석한 권위주의적 행동 유형에 꽤 의존하고 있어.

en: Based on my observation of the movement of particle D, I modify the system so that three possible exits exist.
ko: 입자 D의 움직임을 관찰한 결과를 토대로 출구가 세 개가 되도록 시스템을 수정했어.

en: Can I buy it on easy payment?
We'd like to split it. Could you bring it to us on two plates?
ko: 나눠 먹으려고 하는데, 두 접시에 나눠 주실 수 있어요?

en: I think I understand.
I have the feeling that I understand.
We will contact you as soon as we know.
He nodded when I asked if he understood.
Do you follow?
Do you understand?
Can you answer this?
Okay. Drive safely.
Mark the words that you cannot understand.
Mark the words which you cannot understand.
ko: 이해 안 가는 단어들에 표시해 둬.

en: Ask me whenever you're in doubt.
I know but I can't help it.
You see? You must study a foreign language.
ko: 거봐, 외국어 공부는 꼭 해야 한다니까.

en: You see?
You understand, don't you?
Students who want to major in physics ought to have a sufficient knowledge of mathematics.
ko: 물리학을 전공하려는 학생은 수학 지식이 충분해야 해.

en: Physics can be defined as the science of matter, motion, and energy.
ko: 물리학은 물질, 운동, 에너지를 다루는 과학이라고 정의할 수 있어.

en: Physics is a fundamental natural science.
Physics is not easy to learn.
Which do you like better, physics or chemistry?
ko: 물리랑 화학 중에 뭐가 더 좋아?

en: Physics is my favorite subject.
Physics is my weak subject.
Physics be hanged!
I have become forgetful.
I've become forgetful.
I forgot to lock the storeroom.
Matter can exist as a solid, liquid, or gas.
ko: 물질은 고체, 액체, 기체 상태로 존재할 수 있어.

en: It's the most beautiful night I've seen since I can remember.
ko: 내 기억을 통틀어 가장 아름다운 밤이야.

en: Material standards of living were never higher.
ko: 물질적인 생활 수준은 그 어느 때보다 높아졌어.

en: Matter changes its form according to temperature.
The process by which substances are turned directly from a solid state into a gas is called sublimation.
ko: 고체에서 기체로 바로 변하는 과정을 승화라고 해.

en: When matter is changed chemically, chemical energy is given off.
ko: 물질이 화학적으로 변할 때 화학 에너지가 방출돼.

en: We can hardly settle things by theory alone.
One may as well not know a thing at all, as know it but imperfectly.
ko: 어설프게 아느니 아예 모르는 게 나아.

en: It's very difficult to put things in order.
You should try to see things from the practical point of view.
ko: 좀 현실적인 관점에서 보려고 노력해 봐.

en: Try to do things for yourself.
In doing things, we cannot be too careful.
ko: 무슨 일을 하든 신중해서 나쁠 건 없지.

en: I'm the type who likes to think things over very carefully.
ko: 난 뭐든 아주 깊게 생각하는 편이야.

en: Don't do things by halves.
Take things as they are.
Don't leave things half done.
Don't leave things half finished.
Never do things by halves.
It never rains but it pours.
ko: 안 좋은 일은 꼭 한꺼번에 오더라.

en: See things as they are.
Look at the sunny side of things.
Look on the bright side of things.
One must draw the line somewhere.
I don't like a world where things change so slowly.
ko: 세상이 너무 느리게 변하는 건 싫어.

en: Goods are the great travelers over the earth's surface, far more than humans, which means that hardly an inhabited spot on the globe is untouched by trade.
ko: 상품은 사람보다 세상을 훨씬 더 많이 여행해. 결국 지구상에 무역의 손길이 닿지 않는 곳은 거의 없다는 뜻이야.

en: His bearing announced him as a military man.
The story drew to a conclusion.
The story got more and more interesting.
The story got more and more exciting.
How about the last part of the story?
The action of the story takes place on an island.
My poor dumb friend died this morning.
ko: 불쌍한 내 친구가 오늘 아침에 죽었어.

en: He knows most who speaks least.
ko: 말을 적게 하는 사람이 가장 많이 아는 법이야.

en: The price index hit an all-time high.
A committee was constituted to investigate prices.
Several factors operated to help prices go up.
Prices have soared every year.
Prices are going up every day.
Prices are on the upward trend.
Prices continued to rise.
Commodity prices were rising.
Prices go on rising.
Prices showed a tendency of going up.
Prices will continue to go up.
Prices will continue to rise.
One in four consumers thinks that prices will continue to rise in the future.
ko: 소비자 네 명 중 한 명은 앞으로도 물가가 계속 오를 거라고 생각해.

en: Prices will continue as they are.
Far from falling, the prices of commodities went on rising.
Prices will rise in course of time.
Prices ought to come down soon.
Prices have climbed higher than Mount McKinley.
ko: 물가가 매킨리 산보다 더 높이 치솟았어.

en: Prices are still on the rise.
The prices are going up higher and higher.
Prices have been rising steadily.
Prices have risen steadily during the past decade.
Prices are double what they were two years ago.
Prices are double what they were ten years ago.
Rising costs are fueling anxieties among consumers.
ko: 물가 상승 때문에 소비자들의 불안이 커지고 있어.

en: The rise in prices is pressing our family budget.
ko: 물가 상승이 가계에 큰 부담이 되고 있어.

en: Prices dropped suddenly.
Prices keep on soaring.
Prices are rising.
Prices are going up.
It is certain that prices will go up.
The price rose.
Prices went up.
The cost of living has risen.
